newsitem.title: ITALY: FORECAST-Italy money mkt sees O/N rate under ODR.
newsitem.headline: FORECAST-Italy money mkt sees O/N rate under ODR.

text.p: Forecasts for implicit forward rates show Italy's money market still expects the overnight rate to fall under the current Bank of Italy's 8.25 percent discount rate but implicit rates are at higher levels than a week ago, a study by Bocconi University research arm Igier showed.
On a one-month timeframe the market sees the implicit overnight rate standing at 8.11 percent from an actual market average of 8.38 percent on Thursday, the day on which Igier based its study.
One week ago the implicit overnight rate, on a one month horizon, was seen at 7.69 percent. The three months implicit overnight rate was seen at 8.22 percent.

On a three-month horizon, the implicit overnight rate is seen at 7.69 percent from 7.67 perent seen one week ago. On a one year timeframe, the implicit overnight rate is seen falling to 7.03 percent from 7.12 percent forecast a week ago. On a two year timeframe the implicit overnight rate was seen standing at 7.43 percent from 7.60 percent seen a week ago.

The spread between the implicit Italian overnight rate and the implicit German overnight rate, considered a good indicator of market confidence in Europe's economic and monetary union, is seen at 266 basis points, unchanged from last week's levels. One month ago this spread was seen standing at 329 basis points, three months ago it was forecast at 274 basis points.
